snippet: The defendant had claimed he had acted in self-defense when he shot an unarmed teenager in 2012. A judge said the case reflected the continued misuse of the state’s Stand Your Ground law.
abstract: Michael Dunn, man who was found guilty of premeditated murder in 2012 shooting of unarmed teenager Jordan Russell Davis during a dispute over loud music in Jacksonville, Fla, is sentenced to life in prison without parole.
lead_paragraph: The defendant had claimed he had acted in self-defense when he shot an unarmed teenager in 2012. A judge said the case reflected the continued misuse of the state’s Stand Your Ground law.

headline.main: Florida Man Gets Life Term in Fatal Dispute Over Music
headline.print_headline: Florida Man Gets Life Term in Fatal Dispute Over Music
